I've updated the Outlook add-in to send emails to a webhook when sending from Outlook. Here's what I've done:

1. Modified the manifest.xml to:
   - Add permissions for accessing and sending emails (ReadWriteMailbox)
   - Add support for compose mode
   - Add a button in the compose interface to send emails to the webhook

2. Created a taskpane.html file that provides the UI and functionality for the compose mode

3. Updated server.js to:
   - Add a webhook endpoint at /webhook
   - Process and log received email data
   - Return appropriate responses

4. Enhanced index.html to include the webhook functionality

Now when you compose an email in Outlook with this add-in installed, you can:
- Click the "Send to Webhook" button in the ribbon
- The add-in will extract the email data (subject, body, recipients)
- Send this data to your webhook endpoint
- The server will log the received email data and can be extended to process it further

The webhook endpoint is available at: https://a5b72c7e7272.ngrok-free.app/webhookHAS_CHANGES

   - Request logging for better debugging
   - Proper routes for all HTML files

The add-in now allows you to:
1. View emails in Outlook and click the "Send to Webhook" button in the ribbon
